description.p: A small collection of content based on the series 'World Trigger'. Original concepts are not mine, but I have written this file.
Versatile warriors that use advanced technology in order to wield energy known as Trion in a vast number of ways.
Hit Dice: 1d8 per Trigger User level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per Trigger User level after 1st
Be warned that your physical body only has hit points equal to your Constitution stat. Your calculated hit points belong to your Trion Body.
Armor: None
Weapons: Trigger Holders
Tools: Tinker's Tools
Saving Throws: Constitution and Wisdom
Skills: Choose two skills from Athletics, Acrobatics, Investigation, Insight, Perception, and Survival
- A Trigger Holder
- A set of Tinker's tools
- A dagger
- a) a scholar's pack or b) an explorer's pack

You expel a cube of Trion that splits into multiple smaller cubes. The smaller cubes fly forwards as a flurry of lasers.

All creatures between you and a target in range (including the target) must make a Dexterity saving throw of a DC equal to 15 + your Wisdom modifier. A creature takes 2d8 piercing damage on a failed save. The DC increases by 5 if this is used as a reaction.
This Trigger costs 1 Trion Point to use.
You must have this Trigger equipped to use most Gunner and Sniper Triggers.
You expel a cube of Trion that splits into multiple smaller cubes. The smaller cubes spread out, only to find their target again.
Select a creature in range. That creature takes 2d8 piercing damage. You do not need line of sight as long as you have seen the target and they are in range.
This Trigger costs 2 Trion Points to use. For each additional point you spend (max 6 points total), the damage increases by 1d8.
You expel a cube of Trion that rockets towards a point within range, exploding on impact.

All creatures within 5 ft of the selected point must make a Dexterity saving throw of a DC equal to 15 + your Wisdom modifier. A creature takes 3d10 radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
This Trigger costs 3 Trion Points to use.
You must have this Trigger equipped to use the Launcher Trigger.
You expel a cube of Trion that splits into multiple smaller cubes. The smaller cubes move along a preset path, tearing through things in its path.

Select three targets in range (you can select the same target more than once). Make a ranged attack using your Wisdom stat against each target. On a hit, the first target takes 3d8 piercing damage, the second target takes 2d8 piercing damage, and the third target takes 1d8 piercing damage. You do not need line of sight. However, if you do not have line of sight, you roll your attacks with disadvantage.
This Trigger costs 4 Trion Points to use.
You touch a solid surface and channel Trion into it, causing a reinforced wall to spring out in front of you.

The wall blocks line of sight and has hit points equal to twice your Constitution stat. You can dismiss the wall as a bonus action. The wall will block incoming damage up to its hit points. Any creature behind the wall when it breaks will take any leftover damage.
This Trigger costs 8 Trion Points to use.
You project a transparent disc to block incoming attacks.
Select either a point or a target in range.

Point: The shield has hit points equal to your Constitution modifier. Attacks that would be forced to travel through the selected area cause the attackee to gain 2 AC for that attack only, and, if the attack hits, the shield takes as much damage as it can. Any leftover damage continues to the attackee.

Target: The shield has hit points equal to half your Constitution modifier, and follows the target up to 25 ft away from you. The shield will dismiss itself if the target moves more than 25 ft away from you. The target gains 1 AC as long as the shield is following them. Successful attacks that would be forced to travel through the direction the shield is facing cause the shield takes as much damage as it can. Any leftover damage continues to the attackee.
This Trigger costs 3 Trion Points to use.
A cloak that protects its wearer from divination spells and any effects that would reveal the wearer's position remotely, except for allies' effects.
This Trigger costs 3 Trion Points to summon.
You are under the effects of the Invisibility spell for the duration or until you dismiss this effect.
This Trigger costs 4 Trion Points to use.
You conjure up to three small orbs within range that float around mimicking your energy signature. Detection effects and divination magic will pick up these signals.
This Trigger costs a number of Trion Points equal to the number of orbs you conjure.
You conjure up to three small platforms that propel whatever touches their surface 10 ft in a jumpable direction. Each platform disappears once it propels something.

While being propelled, you cannot be targeted for an attack of opportunity. Also, if you have an Attacker Trigger equipped, you can make a swipe attack on one creature that you pass by for each time you are propelled.
Swipe Attack: Make a standard melee attack roll. On a hit, the target takes half damage.
This Trigger costs 1 Trion Point to use for each platform you conjure.
You conjure six wires from Trion cubes, making the terrain difficult for your enemies.
There must be at least two solid surfaces in range to attach the wires to. Allies can see the wires, but enemies will have to pass a DC 15 Perception check to see them.
Enemies that are within wired areas have disadvantage on their attack rolls and have their movement speed halved.

You have learned to use your Trigger Holder, but it requires Trion from your body. Starting at 1st level, you have Trion Points equal to 3 * your Constitution stat + 5. Activating your Trigger Holder and using Triggers will use these points, and you cannot use either without the necessary points. You can choose to regain Trion Points equal to your Constitution stat on completion of a short rest, but you will gain a level of exhaustion when doing so. Your Trigger Holder cannot be active when you do this. You regain all of your Trion Points on completion of a long rest.

Your Trigger Holder has two columns, each with half the number of your accessible slots. It also has an additional slot for a Gunner Trigger. You can only use one Trigger from each column at a time (or one from your extra slot and one from either column), allowing a maximum of two Triggers at a time. You will gain access to more Triggers and Trigger slots as you gain levels in Trigger User.
By spending time with tinker's tools and your Trigger Holder, you can swap out what Triggers are in your Trigger Holder. For every Trigger you swap out, youmust spend 1 hour.
Starting at 1st level, you are capable of activating your Trigger Holder and have access to the Radar Trigger.

Activating your Trigger holder takes a bonus action and automatically uses the Trion Body Trigger. When your Trigger Holder deactivates, your Trion Body disappears and is replaced by your physical body, and your Trigger Holder cannot be activated again for 5 minutes. You cannot spend Trion Points unless your Trigger Holder is active.

Your physical body is replaced by a body made of Trion. While in your Trion Body, your physical body does not take damage. Remember that your Trion Body has your calculated hit points, while your physical body has hit points equal to your Constitution stat.
When your Trion Body runs out of hit points, it is destroyed and your Trigger Holder deactivates.

If your Trion Body is reduced to under 1/4 of its max hit points, the attack that caused it removes one of your Trion Body's limbs. In this state, you begin losing 2 Trion Points at the start of each of your turns. Being healed above 1/4 of its max hit points does not remove this effect. This effect is dismissed when your Trigger Holder is deactivated.
If your Trigger Holder is deactivated while your Trion Body has more than half its max hit points, you regain 3 Trion Points.

description.p: Starting at 15th level, you can merge Shooter Triggers together for powerful attacks.

When you use a Shooter Trigger, you can expend your bonus action to combine it with another Shooter Trigger. Your Shooter Trigger gains the properties and damage of the second Shooter Trigger for that use.
This requires you to spend the necessary Trion Points for both Shooter Triggers + 1.
